meanings.definition: A collection of Jewish stories and teachings
meanings.sent1: The haggadas on the shelf contain many interesting tales.
meanings.sent2: During Passover, families read haggadas to remember their history.
meanings.sent3: Grandpa's haggadas always make us smile with their funny stories.
meanings.sent4: Her haggadas were like a treasure trove of ancient wisdom.
meanings.sent5: The haggadas painted vivid pictures of tradition and faith.

meanings.definition: The act of telling stories or anecdotes
meanings.sent1: Her haggadas at the campfire captivated everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: The art of haggadas requires good storytelling skills.
meanings.sent3: His haggadas at the party had everyone laughing till tears came.
meanings.sent4: The haggadas of the elders were filled with wisdom passed down through generations.
meanings.sent5: Listening to her haggadas felt like being transported to another time.

meanings.definition: To tell stories or anecdotes in a lively and entertaining way
meanings.sent1: She haggadas about her travels with such enthusiasm.
meanings.sent2: The children begged her to haggadas more stories before bedtime.
meanings.sent3: He haggadas so well that even the birds stopped to listen.
meanings.sent4: The bard haggadas tales of heroes and dragons to the delight of the villagers.
meanings.sent5: Watching her haggadas was like witnessing a master storyteller in action.
